Summary User experience professional with over fifteen years experience designing easy-to-use applications for industry-leading corporations. Excellent communication skills, and experience collaborating in fast-paced, cross-functional environments. 
 
Research 
Usability testing, stakeholder interviews, competitive research, customer surveys, focus groups, interviews, contextual inquiries, usability inspections, card sorting, personas 
 
Analyze 
Goal prioritization (business + user), project vision and roadmap  
 
Design 
Conceptual design, information architecture, interaction design, user flows and workflows, wireframes, low-high fidelity prototypes.  
 
Document 
User-interaction diagrams, storyboards, site maps, functional specifications. • Led design of Enterprise Marketing Management (EMM) applications, including Marketing Performance Optimization, Real-Time Personalization, and our flagship Unica platform.  
• Led design of the Xtify integration, allowing users to create and deliver simple and rich notifications to iOS and Android devices 
• Led research and testing for EMM applications. Created testing materials, conducted usability tests.  
• As an Agile team member, helped assess pain points, set priorities, size work effort, and set milestones User Experience Designer IBM April 2008  –  March 2012  (4 years) Costa Mesa, CA • Led design of web and desktop applications for installing, configuring, and administrating IBM FileNet ECM and related products. Ensured compliance with internal standards for look and feel, accessibility, and globalization. 
• Contributed to the “One UI” initiative, aimed at promoting a consistent look and feel across IBM software 
• Worked across teams to improve FileNet installation time by 30%. Helped plan and deliver 29 multi-day tests, involving 47 local and remote participants. Won “Hero” award for initiative, persistence, teamwork and creativity. 
• Mentored UX interns 
• Received highest rating among my peers and was promoted Senior Interaction Designer Usability.Pro October 2007  –  April 2008  (7 months) Irvine • Conducted extensive usability testing for top-tier GPS client 
• Led design of new features of industry-leading pharmacovigilance system. Features aimed at identifying the hazards associated with pharmaceutical products and minimizing the risk of harming patients. Senior Interaction Designer The First American Corporation November 2005  –  September 2007  (1 year 11 months) First American RES, the nation’s leading provider of real estate information, was spun off as CoreLogic in 2010. 
 
• Coordinated UX workload and acted as department mentor, leading the push for greater usability and consistency across products 
• Led design of list-building site for direct marketers. Included criteria-building wizard, advanced print and export wizards, registration, and CC purchase. 
• Led redesign of Automated Valuation Model platform. Streamlined single and batch report creation processes, allowing for easier retrieval of finished reports. Designed a Process Manager, incorporating a graphical process modeler to create system logic. 
• Led design of application for creating and managing property profiles, farming lists, and mortgage lead lists 
• Led design of real estate investor site, allowing users to easily find listings and foreclosures using advanced criteria, including map-based input. Included registration, subscription, and CC purchase. 
• Led design of Security Manager, allowing administrators to manage users, groups, roles and permissions. Included auditing and usage reporting tools. Senior Interaction Designer / Information Architect The Daily Journal Corporation January 1997  –  November 2005  (8 years 11 months) Daily Journal Corporation publishes the largest daily legal newspaper in the United States. 
 
Web-based Case Management System for Courts

• Designed an eFiling application, allowing outside parties to easily file documents to the system 
• Designed tools for managing users, groups, roles and permissions

Summary Hello! Howdy! How are ya? 
 
I'm Josh Tahmasebi and i'm a designer currently based in Austin,TX. I specialize in Industrial Design and User Experience Design. I graduated 2013 from Arizona State University with a B.S. in Industrial Design and a B.A. in Design Management.  
 
I have experience with both hard and soft goods, as well as, user experience design, branding and packaging design. I also enjoy working through an entire project, seeing it through from sketch to completion.  
 
I am currently employed as a User Experience Designer with IBM, in Austin after moving from Apple in Chicago,IL.  
 
Personal Interests: Learning (learning about anything and everything) languages, history, and experiencing other cultures. I also have love for aviation and other forms of transportation. Summary I'm an award-winning user interface design and usability professional with over 15 years of web/interaction design experience. I'm currently serving as an Interaction Designer at IBM, and I've worked with major companies such as TIAA-CREF, Wachovia, Wells Fargo, Ally Bank and others on complex Internet, intranet, online banking and prominent microsite projects. Many of these initiatives have received industry awards and recognitions. 
 
I've formally served as a UX Lead at TIAA-CREF, a Fortune 100 financial services company and a leading provider of retirement benefits nationwide; Most of my time there was spent working on their new Online Banking platform. 
 
I hold a Master of Science degree in Human-Computer Interaction from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, the nation's oldest technological university.

I was born to design. My passion for making memorable experiences for others is like a thousand  
glorious unicorns stampeding through rainbowed fields of marshmallows. I’ve spent the last 15 years in agencies and corporations making this happen as an user experience designer, professor, and architect. I speak. I sketch. I listen. I build ideas, and I lead multi-discipline teams. My purpose: helping brands and organizations craft their story, shape experiences, and build products with a unique and purposeful vision.

Responsible for all aspects of user experience design including project planning, strategy and research, information architecture, interaction design, and testing. 
 
Specific user experience tasks performed: leading client strategy sessions; collaborative creative brainstorming sessions; conducting stakeholder and user interviews; lightweight user testing/surveying; performing site audits; producing competitive analysis; information architecture documentation; creating site and content maps; sketching; wireframing; providing interactive specifications; and content strategy.

Also responsible for leading all typical user experience deliverables: product visions, creation of user scenarios and use cases, wireframe modeling, flow diagrams, mock-ups, and all visual design for the user interface.
